intro: Schnella storkii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and prefers bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Schnella storkii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
